H0.text: A folded chain of amino acids is part of the description of protein.

H1.text: A folded chain of carbohydrates is part of the description of protein.

H2.text: A branched chain of fatty acids is part of the description of protein.

H3.text: A branched chain of nucleic acids is part of the description of protein.

A4.text: Proteins differ from one another primarily in their sequence of amino acids, which is dictated by the nucleotide sequence of their genes, and which usually results in protein folding into a specific 3D structure that determines its activity.

A5.text: Proteins are large biomolecules that comprise one or more long chains of amino acid residues.
